fullText: The revival of Richard Greenberg's 2003 Tony winner feels fresh and vital, with a superb cast led by Jesse Williams and Jesse Tyler Ferguson bringing new energy to this story of baseball, bigotry and brotherhood.
dtliExcerpt: The revival of Richard Greenberg's 2003 Tony winner feels fresh and vital, with a superb cast led by Jesse Williams and Jesse Tyler Ferguson bringing new energy to this story of baseball, bigotry and brotherhood.
bwwExcerpt: The euphoria of discovery conveyed by Richard Greenberg through a gay outsider who becomes an impassioned baseball fan hasn't dimmed a bit in the two decades since Take Me Out was first produced. Other things, however, have changed in director Scott Ellis' finely tuned and superbly cast Broadway revival for Second Stage. Issues that once seemed too reflective of the playwright's hand at work now seem urgently keyed into a contemporary world in which masculine anxiety and its bilious consequences are being held up for scrutiny.
